params.text: 1. Avoid the passive voice, assigning responsibility to perpetrators of violence;
2. Clearly identifying the violence or harm that occurred and who perpetrated it (Archives for Black Lives in Philadelphia, 2020; Wallace, 2020);
3. Avoid including details that might contribute to fetishization and voyeurism, particularly descriptions of violence, harm, and injuries;
4. Center the experiences of victim-survivors and uplift their humanity
5. Avoid including information about prior arrests, convictions, or other information that may stigmatize the victim-survivor unless directly related to the incident described;
6. Prioritize anti-oppressive, trauma-informed language and replace/remove stigmatizing terms used by law enforcement, the courts, and the media;
7. Clarify and replace overly complicated language or technical terms, including legal terminology.
